captions.text: -Hey, everyone.

I'm Mindy from Cute
Girls Hairstyles

and today we're going to demo
the double side French pony.

So I like this ponytail
and I'm secretly

calling it the girly pony
or the cutesy ponytail

because it's a ponytail and
it has all the great structure

of a ponytail, but it has
a little bit more pizazz
so it's a little girly.

OK, so-- oh, I was going to
say also, I have a lot of fans

ask me because I wash my
hair for, like, three days,

they ask me for style tips
on day one hair, day two
hair, day three hair.

So what I'm going
to show you is kind
of a sequence on this hair.

So day one on her
hair, she just curled

it and you can see
she's got lots of layers

and these are leftover
curls from her--
-From a bun.
-You did a bun?
-A twisty bun.

OK, so she used a bun and
these are the leftover curls.

So day two, because
your hair starts

getting maybe a little
more oily on top,

this is a great way
to hide day two hair.

User a little dry
shampoo and pull it up

into a little puff on top, a
pompadour and use bobby pins.

So day three would
be the one I'm
going to show you right now.

So I'm going to start
by just sectioning off

about from the top of her ears-
I'll turn her so you can see--

back, just straight
back from her ear.

And then I'm just going to
kind of put a clip in there
just to keep it out of the way.

And now I'm just going to start
a very basic French braid.

Because she's getting
a little older

she likes it when I leave
hairs down a little closer
to her face.
She does on herself, too.

And I'm just going to do a
French braid on this side.

And I've already
done the other side.

So you're just going to do
a very quick, easy, basic
French braid.

Just try to kind
of follow that line
that you made with your part.

We're going to maybe-- I
call them stitches, which

is like when you add in hair
and then switch the hairs over,

that's like a
stitch of a braid--

so we're going to do a
few and when we get back

just a little ways, not too
far, we're just going to finish

the braid off, or at least
do a little past that point.
OK.

And then you can use another
clip like this or an elastic
to just hold it.

I'm going to have her just
hold it for me for a second.

And I'll flip her
around so you can see.

We've already done the
other one on this side.

So this is where you get
the double side French braid

name because it has
two French braids.

And we're going to now take--
hold this side, too, please--

just the remainder of
her hair and pull it up
into a high ponytail.

And a great way to
get high ponytails

is to actually turn your head
upside down if you need to,

and then that gives you a
really nice high ponytail when
you're gathering up the hair.

When you get it combed the way
you like it, then simply pull

the French braids back and add
that hair into the ponytail,
as well.
There we go.

Secure it with an elastic,
fluff it a little bit.

I am going to just loosen
this a smidge so that it's

a little bit more
grown-up looking,

and then I'm going to just take
a piece of hair from underneath

and wrap it around that
elastic and bobby pin it.

Or you can run it back
through the elastic--
either one works just fine.

And fluff up the ponytail,
add a little hairspray

to make it look fun,
and you're done.

And you have this fabulous,
girly, totally cutesy ponytail

but still very
functional for people

that are athletic and
doing sports, very cute
for cheerleading.

And it's still an older
adult looking or just cute.
I would even wear this one.
So I hope you enjoy.

Leave a comment below and
tell me if you like it

and if you want to see
more great ponytails.

Also be sure to check out our
Facebook page because we have

lots of fans that post pictures
of how they incorporate

the hairdos that we
do into their lives,

around their own hair, and
it looks great all the time.

You can find us on Facebook
at Cute Girls Hairstyles
is our page name.
So we'll see you guys later.
Hope you enjoy.

title: Double French into High Pony | Cute Girls Hairstyles

comments.text:
Hi Mindy.  I absolutely love your videos.  I actually go through them with 
my 7 yr old daughter and "shop" for hairstyles when she has something 
special coming up.  I've done this hairstyle on her but I place the twin 
frenchbraids along her center part to keep her flyaways in check, and then 
include the braids in her high pony.  Her soccer teammates love it!  ﻿

understand it after watching the videos just once. I got a lot of 
compliments from collegues and guests. So please keep on doing what you are 
doing and thank you for the great inspiration.﻿
